subject: Can't get JUnit failures to print out in Eclipse
msgSnippet: Hi, I m using Eclipse 3.4 on Windows XP.  I am running from JUnit Tests from an Ant file.  One of my tests is failing, but I can t figure out where.  This is
messageBody:
Hi,

I'm using Eclipse 3.4 on Windows XP. I am running from JUnit Tests from an Ant file. One of my tests is failing, but I can't figure out where. This is all that's displayed in my Eclipse console:

http://screencast.com/t/TYoJtCizsp

How can I figure out which test within my class failed in lieu of putting a ton of System.out's everywhere?

Thanks, - Dave


ps - Below is the ant Task and JUnit class

<target name="run-delete-add-test" depends="build-tests">
<junit dir="${build}" fork="true" haltonfailure="true">
<classpath>
<path refid="project.class.path"/>
<pathelement path="${java.class.path}"/>
<pathelement path="${dist}/cedarpointpooledclient.jar"/>
<pathelement path="${build}"/>
</classpath>
<test name="DeleteAddSubscriberTest" todir="${docs}" outfile="junit.delete.add.result">
<formatter type="xml"/>
</test>
</junit>
</target>

==============Start JUnit class=========================
public class DeleteAddSubscriberTest extends TestCase {

private static Logger log = null;
private static Properties test_props = new Properties();
private static CPDelegate deleg = null;

private static String url;
private static String jndi_name;
private static String max_active;
private static String max_idle;
private static String max_wait;

private static String subscriberResp = "";

public static void main(String[] args) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(DeleteAddSubscriberTest.class);

//loadTestProperties();

}


private void loadJUnitTestProperties()
{
try
{
ClassLoader cl = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader();

test_props.load(cl.getResourceAsStream("junit.test.properties"));

}
catch ( Exception e )
{
e.printStackTrace();
fail("loadJUnitTestProperties");
}
}

private void loadJUnitLogProperties(){
Properties props = new Properties();

try
{
ClassLoader cl = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader();

props.load(cl.getResourceAsStream("junit.log.properties"));


PropertyConfigurator.configure(props);

props = null;

log = Logger.getLogger("JUnitLog");
log.debug("Logger loaded.");

}
catch ( Exception e )
{
e.printStackTrace();
fail("loadJUnitLogProperties");
}
}

private void loadDelegate()
{
log = Logger.getLogger("JUnitLog");
log.debug("starting..");
try
{
deleg = new CPDelegate(
test_props.getProperty("cp.service.provider.url"),
test_props.getProperty("cp.service.query.jndi.name"),
test_props.getProperty("cp.pool.max.active"),
test_props.getProperty("cp.pool.max.idle"),
test_props.getProperty("cp.pool.max.wait"),
log
);

}
catch (Exception e)
{
e.printStackTrace();
fail("loadDelegate");
}
}

public void testInitialize() {
loadJUnitLogProperties();
loadJUnitTestProperties();
loadDelegate();
}

public void testGetSubscriber()
{
...
assertTrue(subscriberResp.indexOf(test_props.getProperty("cp.delete.subscriber.tn"))!= -1);
}

public void testDeleteSubscriber()
{
...
assertEquals("SUCCESS", resp);
}

public void testDeleteSubscriberNotFound()
{
...
assertTrue(resp.indexOf("not found")!= -1);
}

public void testAddSubscriberBack()
{
...
assertEquals("SUCCESS", resp);
}

public void testAddSubscriberAlreadyExists()
{
...
assertTrue(resp.indexOf("already exists")!= -1);
}

public void testAddSubscriberMissingServiceId()
{
...
assertTrue(resp.indexOf(CPCustomExceptionMessages.CP_NO_PHONE_NUMBER)!= -1);
}


}
===============end junit class=========================
